intro: Diphasia madagascarienis, commonly known as the Madagascar star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant features strap-like, evergreen leaves that are dark green and glossy. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its unique appearance and limited natural range, it is considered a rare and valuable ornamental plant.
